verbs.description: shush (third-person singular simple present shushes, present participle shushing, simple past and past participle shushed)

entries.meaning: (onomatopoeia, intransitive) To be quiet; to keep quiet.
examples: He wouldn't shush so I kicked him.

entries.meaning: (onomatopoeia, transitive or intransitive) To ask someone to be quiet, especially by saying shh.
examples: The boy in front of us was making too much noise, so we shushed him.
